00040 #ifndef __CVMX_TLB_H__
00041 #define __CVMX_TLB_H__
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @file
00045  *
00046  * cvmx-tlb provides access functions for setting up TLB entries for simple
00047  * executive applications.
00048  *
00049  * <hr>$Revision: 41586 $<hr>
00050  */
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 /**
00059  *  Find a free entry that can be used for share memory mapping.
00060  *
00061  *  @return -1: no free entry found
00062  *  @return :  a free entry
00063  */
00064 int cvmx_tlb_allocate_runtime_entry(void);
00065 
00066 /**
00067  *  Invalidate the TLB entry. Remove previous mapping if one was set up
00068  *  @param tlbi
00069  */
00070 void cvmx_tlb_free_runtime_entry(uint32_t tlbi);
00071 
00072 /**
00073  *  Debug routine to show all shared memory mapping
00074  */
00075 void cvmx_tlb_dump_shared_mapping(void);
00076 
00077 /**
00078  *  Program a single TLB entry to enable the provided vaddr to paddr mapping.
00079  *
00080  *  @param index  Index of the TLB entry
00081  *  @param vaddr  The virtual address for this mapping
00082  *  @param paddr  The physical address for this mapping
00083  *  @param size   Size of the mapping
00084  *  @param tlb_flags  Entry mapping flags
00085  */
00086 void cvmx_tlb_write_entry(int index, uint64_t vaddr, uint64_t paddr, uint64_t size, uint64_t tlb_flags);
00087 
00088 /**
00089  *  Program a single TLB entry to enable the provided vaddr to paddr mapping.
00090  *  This version adds a wired entry that should not be changed at run time
00091  *
00092  *  @param vaddr  The virtual address for this mapping
00093  *  @param paddr  The physical address for this mapping
00094  *  @param size   Size of the mapping
00095  *  @param tlb_flags  Entry mapping flags
00096  *  @return -1: TLB out of entries
00097  *           0:  fixed entry added
00098  *
00099  */
00100 int cvmx_tlb_add_fixed_entry(uint64_t vaddr, uint64_t paddr, uint64_t size, uint64_t tlb_flags);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  *  Program a single TLB entry to enable the provided vaddr to paddr mapping.
00104  *  This version writes a runtime entry. It will check the index to make sure
00105  *  not to overwrite any fixed entries.
00106  *
00107  *  @param index  Index of the TLB entry
00108  *  @param vaddr  The virtual address for this mapping
00109  *  @param paddr  The physical address for this mapping
00110  *  @param size   Size of the mapping
00111  *  @param tlb_flags  Entry mapping flags
00112  */
00113 void cvmx_tlb_write_runtime_entry(int index, uint64_t vaddr, uint64_t paddr, uint64_t size, uint64_t tlb_flags);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  *  Find the TLB index of a given virtual address
00117  *
00118  *  @param vaddr  The virtual address to look up
00119  *  @return  -1  not TLB mapped
00120  *           >=0 TLB TLB index
00121  */
00122 int cvmx_tlb_lookup(uint64_t vaddr);
00123 
00124 /**
00125  *  Debug routine to show all TLB entries of this core
00126  *
00127  */
00128 void cvmx_tlb_dump_all(void);
00129 
00130 /*
00131  * @INTERNAL
00132  * return the next power of two value for the given input <v>
00133  *
00134  * @param v input value
00135  * @return next power of two value for v
00136  */
00137 static inline uint64_t __upper_power_of_two(uint64_t v)
00138 {
00139     v--;
00140     v |= v >> 1;
00141     v |= v >> 2;
00142     v |= v >> 4;
00143     v |= v >> 8;
00144     v |= v >> 16;
00145     v |= v >> 32;
00146     v++;
00147     return v;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /**
00151  * @INTERNAL
00152  * Check if the given value 'v' is power of two.
00153  *
00154  * @param v input value
00155  * @return 1  yes
00156  *     0  no
00157  */ static inline int __is_power_of_two(uint64_t v)
00158 {
00159     int num_of_1s = 0;
00160 
00161     CVMX_DPOP(num_of_1s, v);
00162     return (num_of_1s == 1);
00163 }
00164 
00165 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00166 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00167 }
00168 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00169 #endif
00170 
00171 #endif
